Adequately capable and operational testing laboratories for verification of manufacturer claims and guidance of CSH users to enable informed decisions

No of accredited testing facilities for CSH components and equipment in India
No of Indian CSH system component equipment manufacturers that approached testing laboratories for
No of international CSH system component equipment manufacturers that approached Indian testing laboratories for certification to enable their systems sale in Indian market by EOP

comment.narrative:
2 Nos of test set ups have been established at National Institute of Solar Energy NISE Gurgaon University of Pune UoP Pune
A total of 9 CSH systems have been tested so far supplied from 4 manufacturers at test center of University of Pune Two technologies namely Parabolic Trough Collector PTC and Scheffler were tested through mobile set up Two technologies PTC and Compact Linear Fresnel Reflector CFLR were tested through Immobile test set ups
The activity could be taken up after full functioning of test set ups and establishing their reliability

2 Nos of test set ups have been established at National Institute of Solar Energy NISE Gurgaon University of Pune UoP Pune

The activity could be taken up after full functioning of test set ups and establishing their reliability

description.narrative: Developed CSH performance standards and technology specifications

A document of performance measurement standard developed by year 2
No of minimum performance norms developed by year 2
A document of field performance monitoring guidelines developed by year 2
No of technology specifications developed by EOP
No of performance standards and specifications taken up for consideration and adoption as draft national standards by BIS by year 4

comment.narrative:
Activity completed and reported during PIR 2014 The title of the report is Detailed project report on Development of performance measuring standards test procedures and test protocols for concentrating solar technologies to be used
for process heat applications
The norms developed and posted on MNRE website httpmnregovinfilemanagerUserFilesspecifications_steam_generating_systemspdf These will be verified on the basis of actual performance data collected on various CSHs at Test setups established at National Institute of Solar Energy Gurgaon University of Pune
Field performance norms for CSTs for different regions have already been laid down by an Expert Group and are uploaded on website httpmnregovinfilemanagerUserFilesAnticipatedHeatDeliveryfromCSTsindifferentregionspdf
Draft booklets on technology specification of 5 CSTs prepared These will be finalized in 2015
A meeting with expert group was organized to discuss performance measuring test procedure for CSTs at University of Pune in the presence of BIS official The finalized draft on the test procedure will be sent to BIS for developing standard after validating the data received from testing of CSTs at Test Setups
This will be taken up after BIS standards are in place

for process heat applications

description.narrative: Documented financial viability of CSH technologies applications and mitigation approaches of investment risks

No of Banksfinancial institutions that agreed to finance CSH projects by EOP
No of completed financial viability analyses of CSH technologies and applications by year 3
Analysis of alternative financial options by year 3

comment.narrative:
Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency IREDA has provision for providing loans on Solar Thermal system at normal interest rates This includes CSH systems
Consultations are ongoing with banksFIs to consider providing loans to CSH systems and also to formulate special lending packages for promote CSH systems The target is to get a minimum of 4 banksFIs commit to provide loans for CSH systems
Software for assessing the economics of CST based systems has been developed during the reporting period
ESCO is emerging as alternative financial option PMU has presently approved a few projects The actual learning will be available in subsequent years

description.narrative: Established Concentrating Solar Heat Technology Platform and is operational

An officially established CSH Technology Platform
Number of meetings conducted by the CSH Technology Platform by EOP
No of CSH system users that make use of the platform in addressing issuesproblems concerning energy performance and improvements of CSH systems by EOP
No of CSH system manufacturerssuppliersdistributors that make use of the platform in addressing issuesproblems concerning the market of CSH products by EOP

comment.narrative:
A CSH platform was established during the reporting period It comprises of key stakeholders from Government Technical experts Manufacturers Consultants International Organizations NGOs Test centres etc
In addition CSTEAM a manufacturers association was formed in 201314
First meeting of CSH platform was held in April 2015 with a great enthusiasm among stakeholders It is proposed to have such meeting on quarterly basis In the first meeting several issues were discussed
1 Strengthen implementation there are gaps in implementation and the CSH systems are unable to meet the claimed performance action by suppliers
2 related to financing implementation Policy Promotional activities etcThe major Issues are
3 Delay in inspection Delay in inspection by state nodal agency have multiple impacts Further there will be delay in releasing subsidies This stress on working capital of suppliers This spirals into lack of funds for further installations Action by MNRE
4 Subsidy release on case to case basis It was suggested MNRE release subsidy on casetocase basis to avoid financial stress on suppliers
5 Release the subsidy against bank guarantee MNRE informed this requires modification in the scheme further exploration
6 Issue guidelines to promote CSH systems CREDA representative suggested that the guidelines to promote CSH systems should be issued to relevant government ministries such as HRD and Health Ministry This can enable the government agencies to take up active participation and promotion of the technology in their respective establishments
In addition 2 meetings of CSTEAM by the manufacturers and 2 others of experts manufacturers in MNRE were held in 201314 making a total of 5 such meetings held so far
30 stakeholders participated in 1st CSH Platform meeting In all 80 people participated so far including of CSTEAM other stakeholder interactions organized by MNRE
Around 10 manufacturers participated in these meetings

A CSH platform was established during the reporting period It comprises of key stakeholders from Government Technical experts Manufacturers Consultants International Organizations NGOs Test centres etc
In addition CSTEAM a manufacturers association was formed in 201314
First meeting of CSH platform was held in April 2015 with a great enthusiasm among stakeholders It is proposed to have such meeting on quarterly basis In the first meeting several issues were discussed
1 Strengthen implementation there are gaps in implementation and the CSH systems are unable to meet the claimed performance action by suppliers
2 related to financing implementation Policy Promotional activities etcThe major Issues are
3 Delay in inspection Delay in inspection by state nodal agency have multiple impacts Further there will be delay in releasing subsidies This stress on working capital of suppliers This spirals into lack of funds for further installations Action by MNRE
4 Subsidy release on case to case basis It was suggested MNRE release subsidy on casetocase basis to avoid financial stress on suppliers
5 Release the subsidy against bank guarantee MNRE informed this requires modification in the scheme further exploration
6 Issue guidelines to promote CSH systems CREDA representative suggested that the guidelines to promote CSH systems should be issued to relevant government ministries such as HRD and Health Ministry This can enable the government agencies to take up active participation and promotion of the technology in their respective establishments
In addition 2 meetings of CSTEAM by the manufacturers and 2 others of experts manufacturers in MNRE were held in 201314 making a total of 5 such meetings held so far
30 stakeholders participated in 1st CSH Platform meeting In all 80 people participated so far including of CSTEAM other stakeholder interactions organized by MNRE
Around 10 manufacturers participated in these meetings

description.narrative: Established and supported industryacademic partnership through research programmes to build future capacities

Number of PhDMTech fellowshipsresearch associates supported
Number of fellowships completing PhD MTech by EOP
Number of institutionsuniversities where fellowshipsmaster level courses on CSH technologies are supported

comment.narrative:
Students worked for their MTech degree in relevant area of CSH technology at NISE Thus the total till 30 June 2015 in the project is 14 No financial support was provided from PMU as they got fellowship from their respective institutions
In addition 2 M Tech fellows were supported for the fellowship to work on topics relevant to the project
Mr Lokesh Rana Mr Biblesh Meena joined as project fellows under the supervision of Mr SKSingh Scientist F NISE They are working on performance assessment of data generated through online monitoring systems data analysis and performance mapping of existing CSH technologies and are also involved in setting up of CSTs test facilities at NISE
All 7 number of M Tech students completed their degree while working at NISE in CSH area The details of the students are reported in PIR 2014
One at NISE Gurgaon

description.narrative: Reduced GHG emissions from use of CSH systems for low and medium temperature process heat
Cumulative CO2 emission reduced from start of project to EndOfProject EOP tCO2e

comment.narrative:
Cumulative CO2 emission reduced from start of the project till 30 June 2015 was 2431 tCO2 During the reporting period 365 tCO2 emissions reduced
14 CSH demonstration projects 6700 sqm were sanctioned during the year 3 of them 1415 sqm installed They are Siddharath Surgical Valsad 263 m2 commissioned in July 2014 It is estimated to reduce 92 tCO2 annually Neel Metals Manesar 612 m2 was commissioned in November 2014 estimated to reduce 143 tCO2 annually Unique Biotech Hyderabad 540 m2 was commissioned in March 2015 estimated to reduce 63 tCO2 annually
One Replication project 338 m2 and 11 smaller projects 1162 m2 were supported under the project 3 projects 291 m2 were commissioned CMC Vellore 104 m2 in July 14 reduce 36tCO2 annually MSA Vadodara 55 m2 in Oct 14 reduce 16 tCO2 annually and PSG Hospital Coimbatore in Oct 14 reduce 15 tCO2 annually

One Replication project 338 m2 and 11 smaller projects 1162 m2 were supported under the project 3 projects 291 m2 were commissioned CMC Vellore 104 m2 in July 14 reduce 36tCO2 annually MSA Vadodara 55 m2 in Oct 14 reduce 16 tCO2 annually and PSG Hospital Coimbatore in Oct 14 reduce 15 tCO2 annually

Target met
Total 15 training programmes were conducted
13 training programmes on Operation Maintenance of CSH systems in 12 different places in the country for the ITI students and operators of systems at beneficiary places1 one training programme for the beneficiary of CSTs was organized at NISE Gurgaon
1 World Renewable Spiritual Trust WRST at Mount Abu for the entrepreneurs
During reporting period 150 people trained Cumulatively 450 people trained so far under various training programmes
3 exposure visits were conducted including 1 international and 2 national
5 persons had exposure to testing Stuttgurt University advanced development DLR Kolon and standards setting Stuttgurt in Germany The participants included 2 senior officials from MNRE one from UNDP from industry and one GIZ The mission included visits to DLR Cologne Fraunhofer Institute of Solar Energy Freiburg Stuttgart University and few installations
10 persons participated in 2 national exposure visits These included 1 to Mount AbuA testing and demonstration centre and 1 to Hyderabad field installations

Target met
Training needs assessment conducted Accordingly one set of training at different potential CSH clusters was conducted by a consulting firm Anthropower
Second programme is a residential training at Mount Abu Awareness cum training centre has been established at Mount Abu for organizing the training programme entrepreneurs employees of manufacturers
6 training Manuals developed They cover 6 different CSH technologies The manuals are developed in Hindi and English languages These were developed by AnthroPower and uploaded on MNRE CSH websites with link httpwwwcshindiainListofReportshtml

Not taken up during the year
1 National training cum awareness programme on Online performance monitoring of CSH systems was organized at NISE Performance Monitoring of 15 CST based installation under CSH project was presented The programme was held on 11th July 2014 at NISE Gurgaon for the beneficiaries of CSTs installations
